alert.note: Alert for Brown (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 09 at 8:50PM CDT until April 15 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Cottonwood River Above Springfield affecting Brown County. Cottonwood River at New Ulm affecting Brown County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River At Morton affecting Redwood and Renville Counties. South Fork Crow River below Mayer affecting Carver County. .River rises from melting snow will results in minor flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cottonwood River Above Springfield. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Saturday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 730 PM CDT Sunday, the stage was 17.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 25.5 feet Tuesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.7 feet on 06/19/2014. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
